commit_message:
WIP: Add request id to returned objects

Wrap existing objects returned from API
using wrapt.ObjectProxy to add request_ids
property.

Implements: blueprint return-request-id-to-caller
Change-Id: Iaa35b79c13cf3dd53883f039a8f3416178a0f081
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/52/316052/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import wrapt class RequestIdProxy(wrapt.ObjectProxy): def __init__(self, wrapped): super(RequestIdProxy, self).__init__(wrapped) self._self_wrapped = wrapped self._self_request_ids = [] def _set_request_ids(self, request_ids): self._self_request_ids.append(request_ids) @property def request_ids(self): return self._self_request_ids @property def wrapped(self): return self._self_wrapped def add_request_ids(obj, resp): proxy = RequestIdProxy(obj) req_id = resp.headers.get('x-openstack-request-id') proxy._set_request_ids(req_id) return proxy

commit_message:
Use systemd module instead of shell

Using ansible systemd module to daemon reload and service reload is the solution for the future.

Change-Id: I5ff23e73b10c54648f90573f782033678f8d7a13

subject: Provide a list of request ids to the caller
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-24 12:09:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient/commit/c1e993b57a002e77c4077dc90378b21c0ad4a5f7', 'message': "Provide a list of request ids to the caller

Each API call is modified so that the caller has an option to ask
for a 'list of request ids' for the various 'requests' made
during the call.

The API methods now take an extra argument 'request_ids' to accept
reference to an empty list. The code utilizes requests module's
'event hook' facility to call a callback function when the request
is made. This function extracts request id from the response object
and appends to the caller supplied list.

Example Usage:
>>> import glanceclient
>>> glance = glanceclient.Client('2', endpoint='...', token='...')
>>> ids = []
>>> lst = glance.images.list(request_ids=ids)
>>> ids
['req-id-1', 'req-id-2', ...]

Closes-Bug: #1525259
Blueprint: return-request-id-to-caller

Change-Id: Ifbb02ae5209fff2db7f8bff720fe5a9ad18b6c68

commit_message:
Provide a list of request ids to the caller

Each API call is modified so that the caller has an option to ask
for a 'list of request ids' for the various 'requests' made
during the call.

The API methods now take an extra argument 'request_ids' to accept
reference to an empty list. The code utilizes requests module's
'event hook' facility to call a callback function when the request
is made. This function extracts request id from the response object
and appends to the caller supplied list.

Example Usage:
>>> import glanceclient
>>> glance = glanceclient.Client('2', endpoint='...', token='...')
>>> ids = []
>>> lst = glance.images.list(request_ids=ids)
>>> lst.next()
.....
.....
>>> ids
['req-id-1', 'req-id-2', ...]

Added release notes for the change.

Closes-Bug: #1525259
Blueprint: return-request-id-to-caller

commit_message:
Fixes converter not working for certain edge cases.

Currently, the converter framework is not robust enough to handle
all policy cases. For example, is_admin context breaks.

This patch makes the converter more robust. The converter was changed
to use oslo_policy's shell tool for figuring out which roles are
permitted for a given rule. The shell tool can be found here:
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.policy/blob/master/oslo_policy/shell.py

Because the shell tool is intended to be used as a CLI tool, it was
adapted from oslo policy to better work within Patrole.

implements blueprint: oslo-policy-converter

Change-Id: Ia0fe9113e2be44e609b0edbb4c6facd1425f28b5

commit_message:
Removing payloads from the repo

As we have added payloads to the new repo and already
updated the docs to reflect the same, there is no need
to have payloads in the main repo, thus removing them.

commit_message:
Add pylev to global requirements

This library provides string distance functions commonly used for
spellchecking. The damerau_levenshtein function will be used by oslo.config.

- Is the library actively maintained?

Very rarely, but it's a tiny library that accomplishes its goal
so there isn't much to maintain.

- Is the library good code?

Yes, it implements well-known algorithms in a pythonic manner. However,
it is not PEP8-compliant (lines over 79 chars).

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes.

- Is the library license compatible?

Yes. It's New BSD.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

No.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

No.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

Yes, oslo.config validator [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384559

Change-Id: I929a5e06a402e2905b9776c9de89d0f5405885aa

commit_message:
Update container format choices

The choices for valid container formats is out of date in the
image v1 and v2 help text.  This patch adds 'ova' and 'docker'
and does some minor refactoring to align the container_format
option with the disk_format option.

Change-Id: Icdea5fab801abd651baf45cf96c920c7df79f11b
